intro: Amsinckia manningiae, commonly known as the Manning's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of tiny, tubular florets. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Amsinckia manningiae is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
